FuncDef:
The tiebreaker preference command sets the solution of selecting a backup path for IS-IS Auto FRR.
The undo tiebreaker preference command restores the default solution of selecting a backup path for IS-IS Auto FRR. The tiebreaker preference command sets the solution of selecting a backup path for IS-IS Auto FRR. The undo tiebreaker preference command restores the default solution of selecting a backup path for IS-IS Auto FRR. By default, the node-protection path first solution is used in IS-IS Auto FRR.
CLIs: tiebreaker { node-protecting | lowest-cost | non-ecmp | srlg-disjoint | hold-max-cost } preference <preference> [ level-1 | level-2 | level-1-2 ]
undo tiebreaker { node-protecting | lowest-cost | non-ecmp | srlg-disjoint | hold-max-cost } [ preference <preference> ] [ level-1 | level-2 | level-1-2 ]

ParaDef.Info:
Sets the solution of selecting a backup path for IS-IS Auto FRR to node-protection path first.
-

Sets the solution of selecting a backup path for IS-IS Auto FRR to smallest-cost path first.
-

Sets the solution of selecting a backup path for IS-IS Auto FRR to non-ECMP first.
-

Sets the solution of selecting a backup path for IS-IS Auto FRR to shared risk link group (SRLG) disjoint first.
-

Sets the solution of selecting a backup path for IS-IS Auto FRR to the maximum cost path first.
-

Specifies a priority for the solution. The larger the value, the higher the priority.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 255.

Sets the solution of selecting a backup path for Level-1 IS-IS Auto FRR.
-

Sets the solution of selecting a backup path for Level-2 IS-IS Auto FRR.
-

Sets the solution of selecting a backup path for both Level-1 and Level-2 IS-IS Auto FRR.
-

ExtraInfo: In IS-IS Auto FRR, the solution of protecting nodes is preferred for selecting a backup path. However, in an actual network, due to factors such as interface data capability or link cost, the solution of selecting a backup path may need to be adjusted to a path with the minimum cost or another optional path. In this case, you can run the tiebreaker command to adjust the value.
